lines.name: Campaign ID
lines.desc: The unique identification number of your Google Ads campaign.

lines.name: Campaign
lines.desc: The name of your ad campaign or custom campaign that you manually tagged with the utm_campaign parameter.

lines.name: Default channel grouping
lines.desc:
Channel groupings are rule-based definitions of your traffic sources.

          Default channel groupings include 'Direct', 'Organic Search', 'Paid Social', 'Organic Social', 'Email', 'Affiliates', 'Referral', 'Paid Search', 'Video', and 'Display'.

lines.name: Google Ads account name
lines.desc: The account name in Google Ads of the ad that led to a conversion event.

lines.name: Google Ads ad group ID
lines.desc: The unique identification number of your Google Ads ad group.

lines.name: Google Ads ad group name
lines.desc: The ad group name in Google Ads of the ad that led to a conversion event.

lines.name: Google Ads ad network type
lines.desc: The location where your ad was shown (google.com, search partners, display network) that led to a conversion event.

lines.name: Google Ads campaign ID
lines.desc:
The campaign ID for the Google Ads campaign attributed to the conversion 
event.

lines.name: Google Ads campaign
lines.desc:
The campaign name for the Google Ads campaign attributed to the conversion 
event.

lines.name: Google Ads campaign type
lines.desc:
The campaign type for the Google Ads campaign attributed to the conversion 
event. Campaign types determine where customers see your ads and the 
settings and options available to you in Google Ads. Campaign type is an 
enumeration that includes: Search, Display, Shopping, Video, Discovery, 
App, Smart, Hotel, Local, and Performance Max. To learn more, see 
https://support.google.com/google-ads/answer/2567043.

lines.name: Google Ads creative ID
lines.desc:
The ID of the Google Ads creative attributed to the conversion event. 
Creative IDs identify individual ads.

lines.name: Google Ads customer ID
lines.desc: The 10-digit Google Ads Customer ID.

lines.name: Google Ads keyword text
lines.desc: The matched keyword that led to a conversion event.

lines.name: Google Ads query
lines.desc: The search query that led to a conversion event.

lines.name: Last click Google Ads ad account name
Last click Google Ads ad group ID
lines.desc: The campaign Ad Group ID attributed to the conversion event, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click Google Ads ad group name
lines.desc: The campaign Ad Group name attributed to the conversion event, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click Google Ads ad network type
lines.desc: The network type attributed to the conversion event, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click Google Ads campaign ID
Last click Google Ads campaign channel
Last click Google Ads creative ID
lines.desc: The creative ID attributed to the conversion event, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click Google Ads campaign external customer ID
Last click Google Ads medium
lines.desc: The medium attributed to the conversion event, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click Google Ads campaign
lines.desc: The campaign attributed to the conversion event, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click Google Ads campaign query
Last click Google Ads campaign query word count
Last click Google Ads source
lines.desc: The source attributed to the conversion event, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click Google Ads source / medium
lines.desc: The campaign source and medium attributed to the conversion event, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click Google Ads source platform
Last click Google Ads keyword match type
Last click Google Ads keyword text
Last click Google Ads query match type
Last click ad group ID
lines.desc: The campaign Ad Group ID attributed to the conversion event, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click ad group name
lines.desc: The campaign Ad Group name to which the conversion event is attributed, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click ad network type
lines.desc: The network type to which the conversion event is attributed, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click creative ID
lines.desc: The creative ID to which the conversion event is attributed, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click campaign external customer ID
Last click medium
lines.desc: The medium to which the conversion event is attributed, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click campaign
lines.desc: The campaign to which the conversion event is attributed, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click campaign query word count
Last click source
lines.desc: The source to which the conversion event is attributed, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click source / medium
lines.desc: The campaign source and medium to which the conversion event is attributed, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model. Learn more about conversions.

lines.name: Last click keyword text match type
Last engaged Google Ads ad account name
Last engaged Google Ads ad group ID
Last engaged Google Ads ad group name
Last engaged Google Ads ad network type
Last engaged Google Ads campaign ID
Last engaged Google Ads campaign channel
Last engaged Google Ads campaign external customer ID
Last engaged Google Ads campaign query
Last engaged Google Ads campaign query word count
Last engaged Google Ads source / medium
Last engaged Google Ads source platform
Last engaged Google Ads campaign type
Last engaged Google Ads keyword match type
Last engaged Google Ads keyword text
Last engaged Google Ads query match type
Last engaged campaign external customer ID
Last engaged campaign query word count
Manual ad content
lines.desc: The ad content that is attributed to a conversion event. Learn more

lines.name: Manual term
lines.desc: The term that is attributed to a conversion event. Learn more

lines.name: Medium
lines.desc:
The method for acquiring users to your website or application.

          Examples include:

          
            'affiliate': users who click a link through an affiliate program
            'cpc': (short for cost-per-click) users who click a paid advertisement
            'email': users who click a link in an email marketing campaign
            'organic': users who click a link from a search engine
            'referral': users who click a link on a website (e.g., a link in a video description)
            '(none)': direct traffic

lines.name: SA360 ad group name
lines.desc: The name of the ad group of a Search Ads 360 ad that led to a conversion event.

lines.name: SA360 keyword text
lines.desc: The keyword of a Search Ads 360 ad that led to a conversion event.

lines.name: SA360 query
lines.desc: The query that triggered a Search Ads 360 ad to appear and that led to a conversion event.

lines.name: Source
lines.desc:
A representation of the publisher or inventory source from which traffic originated. For example, users who return to your website from Google Search show as 'google' in the Session source dimension.

          Examples include “google”, “youtube”, and “gmail”.

lines.name: Source / medium
lines.desc: The source and medium that led a user to arrive on your website or application.

lines.name: Source platform
lines.desc:
The platform where you manage buying activity (such as where budgets, targeting criteria, and so on are set).

          Examples include:

          
            'DV360' (traffic from Display & Video 360 marketing activity)
            'Google Ads' (traffic from Google Ads marketing activity)
            'Manual' (traffic that isn't from Google media marketing activity)
            'SA360' (traffic from Search Ads 360 marketing activity)
            'SFMC' (traffic from Salesforce Marketing Cloud marketing activity)
            'Shopping Free Listings' (traffic from Google Merchant Center marketing activity)

lines.name: Cohort
lines.desc: A set of users who started using your website or app at the same time (such as on the same day, or during the same week).

lines.name: Daily cohort
lines.desc:
Day offset relative to the firstSessionDate for the users in the cohort. 
For example, if a cohort is selected with the start and end date of 
2020-03-01, then for the date 2020-03-02, cohortNthDay will be 0001.

lines.name: Monthly cohort
lines.desc:
Month offset relative to the firstSessionDate for the users in the cohort. 
Month boundaries align with calendar month boundaries. For example, if a 
cohort is selected with the start and end date in March 2020, then for any 
date in April 2020, cohortNthMonth will be 0001.

lines.name: Weekly cohort
lines.desc:
Week offset relative to the firstSessionDate for the users in the cohort. 
Weeks start on Sunday and end on Saturday. For example, if a cohort is 
selected with the start and end date in the range 2020-11-08 to 2020-11-14, 
then for the dates in the range 2020-11-15 to 2020-11-21, cohortNthWeek 
will be 0001.

lines.name: Cohort active users
lines.desc:
The number of users in the cohort who are active in the time window 
corresponding to the cohort nth day/week/month. For example for the row 
where cohortNthWeek = 0001, this metric is the number of users (in the 
cohort) who are active in week 1.

lines.name: Cohort total users
lines.desc:
The total number of users in the cohort. This metric is the same value in 
every row of the report for each cohort. Because cohorts are defined by a 
shared acquisition date, cohortTotalUsers is the same as cohortActiveUsers 
for the cohort's selection date range. For report rows later than the 
ochort's selection range, it is typical for cohortActiveUsers to be smaller 
than cohortTotalUsers. This difference represents users from the cohort 
that were not active for the later date. cohortTotalUsers is commonly used 
in the metric expression cohortActiveUsers/cohortTotalUsers to compute a 
user retention fraction for the cohort. The relationship between 
activeUsers and totalUsers is not equivalent to the relationship between 
cohortActiveUsers and cohortTotalUsers.

lines.name: Event name
lines.desc: The name of an event. For example, if someone triggers a purchase event, the text 'purchase' populates the dimension.

lines.name: Is conversion event
lines.desc: The text 'true' when an event was marked as a conversion.

lines.name: Conversions
lines.desc: The number of times users triggered a conversion event.

lines.name: Event count
lines.desc: The number of times users triggered an event.

lines.name: Event count per user
lines.desc: The average number of events triggered per user.

lines.name: Event value
lines.desc: The sum of all value parameters supplied with an event. You can use this context-sensitive metric to capture data that's important to you (e.g., revenue, time, distance).

lines.name: Events per session
lines.desc: The average number of events per session.

lines.name: First opens
lines.desc: The number of times your users opened your application for the first time.

lines.name: First visits
lines.desc: The number of times your users opened your website for the first time.

lines.name: File extension
lines.desc: The extension of a file download (for example, 'pdf' or 'txt').

lines.name: File name
lines.desc: The page path of a file download (for example, '/menus/dinner-menu.pdf').

lines.name: Group ID
lines.desc: The group ID when a user joins a group. This dimension allows you to measure the popularity of various clans or user groups.

lines.name: Message ID
lines.desc: The ID of the Firebase Cloud Messaging campaign.

lines.name: Message name
lines.desc: The name of the Firebase Cloud Messaging campaign.

lines.name: Method
lines.desc: The method used to sign up, login, or share (e.g., Google, Twitter, etc.).

lines.name: Percent scrolled
lines.desc: The percentage down the page that the user scrolled. If someone scrolls at least 90% of a page, the value '90' populates the dimension. Otherwise, the dimension is blank.

lines.name: Search term
lines.desc: The term used to search your website or application.

lines.name: Test data filter name
lines.desc: The name of a data filter in a testing state. You can use data from your data filters that are in a testing state to validate your filters before activating them.

lines.name: Topic
lines.desc: The topic associated with the Firebase Cloud Messaging campaign.

lines.name: Visible
lines.desc: The text 'true' when an embedded video is visible to the user.

lines.name: Content ID
lines.desc: The ID that you assign to a content group.

lines.name: Content type
lines.desc: The type of content group.

lines.name: Full page URL
lines.desc:
The hostname, page path, and query string for web pages visited; for 
example, the fullPageUrl portion of 
https://www.example.com/store/contact-us?query_string=true is 
www.example.com/store/contact-us?query_string=true.

lines.name: Hostname
lines.desc: The subdomain and domain names of a URL that people visited on your website. For example, the hostname of 'www.example.com/contact.html' is 'www.example.com'.

lines.name: Landing page
lines.desc: The page path and query string associated with the first pageview in a session.

lines.name: Page location
lines.desc: The complete URL of the webpage that someone visited on your website. For example, if someone visits www.googlemerchandisestore.com/Bags?theme=1, then the complete URL will populate the dimension.

lines.name: Page path + query string
lines.desc: The page path and query strings in a URL. These are the parts of the URL that come after the domain. For example, if someone visits www.googlemerchandisestore.com/Bags?theme=1, then 'googlemerchandisestore.com' is the domain, 'Bags' is the page path, and 'theme=1' is the query string.

lines.name: Page path
lines.desc:
The portion of the URL between the hostname and query string for web pages 
visited; for example, the pagePath portion of 
https://www.example.com/store/contact-us?query_string=true is 
/store/contact-us.

lines.name: Page referrer
lines.desc: The referring URL, which is the user's previous URL and can be your website's domain or other domains.

lines.name: Content group
lines.desc: The content group associated with a page or screen. For example, if you create a content group for Men's clothing using the value 'mens', the value 'mens' populates the dimension for pages with Men's clothing.

lines.name: Page title
lines.desc: The page title that you set on your website.

lines.name: App screen name
lines.desc: The name of the screen being viewed when the user event happens within an app.

lines.name: Page path and screen class
lines.desc: The page path (web) or screen class (app) on which the event was logged.

lines.name: Page path + query string and screen class
lines.desc: The web page path and default app screen class.

lines.name: Page title and screen class
lines.desc: The page title from a website and screen class from a mobile application.

lines.name: Page title and screen name
lines.desc: The page title from a website and screen name from a mobile application.

lines.name: Entrances
lines.desc: The number of times that the first event recorded for a session occurred on a page or screen. Learn more

lines.name: Exits
lines.desc: The number of times that the last event recorded for a session occurred on a page or screen. Learn more

lines.name: Views
lines.desc: The number of mobile app screens or web pages your users saw. Repeated views of a single screen or page are counted.

lines.name: Views per session
lines.desc: The average number of pages or screens viewed in a session.

lines.name: Views per user
lines.desc: The average number of mobile app screens or web pages viewed per user.

lines.name: Screen views
lines.desc: The number of screens your users saw . Repeated views of a single screen are counted. (event triggered: screen_view)

lines.name: Ad format
lines.desc: The format of an ad. Typical formats include 'Banner', 'Interstitial', and 'Rewarded'.

lines.name: Ad source
lines.desc:
The source network that served an ad. Typical sources include 'AdMob Network', 'Meta Audience Network', and 'Mediated house ads'.

          When you integrate with Google Ad Manager, this dimension represents the Google Ad Manager Network name (e.g., 'Bloomberg L.P. (Google Ad Manager Network 5262)'.

lines.name: Ad unit
lines.desc: The name you chose for an ad unit. When you integrate with Google Ad Manager, this dimension represents Ad unit (all levels).

lines.name: Ad exposure
lines.desc: The total time that your ad units were shown to a user (in milliseconds).

lines.name: Ad revenue
lines.desc: The sum of the advertising revenue for a user.

lines.name: Ad unit exposure
lines.desc: The time that a given ad unit was shown to a user (in milliseconds).

lines.name: Session number
lines.desc: The ordinal number of the session in which the selected event occurred.

lines.name: Average session duration
lines.desc: The average duration (in seconds) of users' sessions.

lines.name: Bounce rate
lines.desc: The percentage of sessions that were not engaged sessions. Learn more

lines.name: Engaged sessions
lines.desc: The number of sessions that lasted 10 seconds or longer, or had 1 or more conversion events or 2 or more page or screen views.

lines.name: Engaged sessions per user
lines.desc: The average number of engaged sessions per user.

lines.name: Engagement rate
lines.desc: The percentage of sessions that were engaged sessions. Learn more

lines.name: Session conversion rate
lines.desc:
The percentage of sessions that converted.

          This metric is calculated as the number of sessions in which a conversion happened divided by the total number of sessions.

lines.name: Session conversion rate for one conversion
lines.desc: The percentage of sessions in which a specific conversion event was triggered. Learn more

lines.name: Sessions per user
lines.desc: The average number of sessions per user.

lines.name: Sessions
lines.desc: The number of sessions that began on your website or application.

lines.name: Sessions per user
lines.desc: The average number of sessions per user.

lines.name: Audience ID
lines.desc:
Audiences to which users belonged when they triggered events during the date range of the report.
Learn more

lines.name: Audience name
lines.desc: The name of an audience that users belong to during the date range selected. Current user behavior does not affect historical audience membership in reports.

lines.name: New / established
lines.desc: New and established users who first opened your app or visited your website within the last 7 days.

lines.name: New / returning
lines.desc:
New users have 0 previous sessions, and returning users have 1 or more 
previous sessions. This dimension returns two values: 'new' or 'returning'.

lines.name: Signed in with user ID
lines.desc: The text 'yes' when you collect a user_id, which can help you connect separate sessions to an individual user.

lines.name: Active users
lines.desc:
The number of distinct users who visited your website or application. An active user is any user who has an engaged session or when Analytics collects:

          
            the first_visit event or engagement_time_msec parameter from a website
            the first_open event or engagement_time_msec parameter from an Android app
            the first_open or user_engagement event from an iOS app

lines.name: 1-day active users
lines.desc: The number of unique users on your site or app within a 1 day period. The 1 day period includes the last day in your active date range. Note: this is the same as Active users.  How Analytics calculates the number of users.

lines.name: 28-day active users
lines.desc: The number of unique users on your site or app within a 28 day period. The 28 day period includes the last day in your active date range.  How Analytics calculates the number of users.

lines.name: 7-day active users
lines.desc: The number of unique users on your site or app within a 7 day period. The 7 day period includes the last day in your active date range. How Analytics calculates the number of users.

lines.name: Average daily purchasers
lines.desc: The average number of purchasers across all the days in the selected time frame.

lines.name: DAU / MAU
lines.desc: Daily Active Users (DAU) / Monthly Active Users (MAU) shows the percentage of users who engaged for the calendar day out of the users who engaged in the last 30 days. A higher ratio suggests good engagement and user retention.

lines.name: DAU / WAU
lines.desc: Daily Active Users (DAU) / Weekly Active Users (WAU) shows the percentage of users who engaged in the last 24 hours out of the users who engaged in the last 7 days. A higher ratio suggests good engagement and user retention.

lines.name: First-time purchaser conversion
lines.desc: First-time buyer (FTB). Percentage of active users that completed their first purchase event for the time period selected.

lines.name: First time purchasers
lines.desc: The number of users who made their first purchase in the selected time frame.

lines.name: First-time purchasers per new user
lines.desc: First-time buyers (FTB) per new users. Ratio of active users that completed their first purchase event divided by new users for the time period selected. These two populations are exclusive.

lines.name: Max daily purchasers
lines.desc: The maximum number of purchasers across all the days in the selected time frame.

lines.name: Min daily purchasers
lines.desc: The minimum number of purchasers across all the days in the selected time frame.

lines.name: New users
lines.desc: The number of users with 0 previous sessions. Users who already have had a session are returning users.

lines.name: 30-day paid active users
lines.desc: The number of customers who complete 1 or more purchases in the last 30 days.

lines.name: 7-day paid active users
lines.desc: The number of customers who complete 1 or more purchases in the last 7 days.

lines.name: 90-day paid active users
lines.desc: The number of customers who complete 1 or more purchases in the last 90 days.

lines.name: PMAU / DAU
lines.desc: Paying Monthly Active Users (PMAU) / Daily Active Users (DAU) shows you the percentage of active users who have made a purchase in the prior month.

lines.name: PWAU / DAU
lines.desc: Paying Weekly Active Users (PWAU) / Daily Active Users (DAU) shows you the percentage of active users who have made a purchase in the prior week.

lines.name: 1-day repeat purchasers
lines.desc: The number of customers who complete 1 or more purchases in 2 consecutive days.

lines.name: 2–7-day repeat purchasers
lines.desc: The number of customers who purchased one day and anytime between 2 and 7 days prior.

lines.name: 31–90-day repeat purchasers
lines.desc: The number of customers who purchased one day and anytime between 31 and 90 days prior.

lines.name: 8–30-day repeat purchasers
lines.desc: The number of customers who purchased one day and anytime between 8 and 30 days prior.

lines.name: Returning users
lines.desc: The number of users who have initiated at least one previous session, regardless of whether or not the previous sessions were engaged sessions.

lines.name: Total purchasers
lines.desc: The number of unique users who made at least one purchase.

lines.name: Total users
lines.desc: The total number of unique users who triggered at least one event.

lines.name: User conversion rate
lines.desc:
The percentage of users who converted.

          This metric is calculated as the number of users who performed a conversion action divided by the total number of users.

lines.name: User conversion rate for one conversion
lines.desc: The percentage of users who triggered a specific conversion event. Learn more

lines.name: User engagement
lines.desc: The length of time that your app screen was in the foreground or your web page was in focus. Learn more about user engagement.

lines.name: Average engagement time per session
lines.desc: The average engagement time per session.

lines.name: WAU / MAU
lines.desc: Weekly Active Users (DAU) / Monthly Active Users (MAU) shows the percentage of users who engaged in the last 7 days out of the users who engaged in the last 30 days. A higher ratio suggests good engagement and user retention.

lines.name: First user campaign ID
lines.desc: The ID of the campaign by which the user was first acquired.

lines.name: First user campaign
lines.desc: The campaign by which the user was first acquired.

lines.name: First user CM360 default channel grouping
First user CM360 placement cost structure
First user default channel grouping
lines.desc: The default channel grouping by which the user was first acquired.

lines.name: First user DV360 default channel grouping
First user DV360 insertion order ID
First user DV360 insertion order name
First user DV360 line item ID
First user DV360 line item name
First user Google Ads account name
lines.desc: The Google Ads account name by which the user was first acquired.

lines.name: First user Google Ads ad group ID
lines.desc: The Google Ads ad group ID by which the user was first acquired.

lines.name: First user Google Ads ad group name
lines.desc: The Google Ads ad group name by which the user was first acquired.

lines.name: First user Google Ads ad network type
lines.desc: The Google Ads ad network type by which the user was first acquired.

lines.name: First user Google Ads campaign ID
lines.desc:
Identifier of the Google Ads marketing campaign that first acquired the 
user.

lines.name: First user Google Ads campaign
lines.desc: Name of the Google Ads marketing campaign that first acquired the user.

lines.name: First user Google Ads campaign type
lines.desc:
The campaign type of the Google Ads campaign that first acquired the user. 
Campaign types determine where customers see your ads and the settings and 
options available to you in Google Ads. Campaign type is an enumeration 
that includes: Search, Display, Shopping, Video, Discovery, App, Smart, 
Hotel, Local, and Performance Max. To learn more, see 
https://support.google.com/google-ads/answer/2567043.

lines.name: First user Google Ads creative format
First user Google Ads creative ID
lines.desc:
The ID of the Google Ads creative that first acquired the user. Creative 
IDs identify individual ads.

lines.name: First user Google Ads customer ID
lines.desc: The Google Ads customer ID by which the user was first acquired.

lines.name: First user Google Ads default channel grouping
First user Google Ads keyword text
lines.desc: The Google Ads keyword by which the user was first acquired

lines.name: First user Google Ads query
lines.desc: The Google Ads search query by which the user was first acquired

lines.name: First user manual ad content
lines.desc: The ad content that was used to first acquire a user.

lines.name: First user manual default channel grouping
First user manual term
lines.desc: The term that was used to first acquire the user.

lines.name: First user medium
lines.desc: The medium by which the user was first acquired.

lines.name: First user SA360 ad group name
First user SA360 default channel grouping
First user SA360 engine account ID
First user SA360 engine account name
First user SA360 engine account type
First user source
lines.desc: The source by which the user was first acquired.

lines.name: First user source / medium
lines.desc: The source and medium by which the user was first acquired.

lines.name: First user source platform
lines.desc: The source platform by which the user was first acquired.

lines.name: Last click Google Ads session ad account name
Last click Google Ads session ad group ID
Last click Google Ads session ad group name
Last click Google Ads session ad network type
Last click Google Ads session campaign ID
Last click Google Ads session channel

Last click Google Ads session campaign

Last click Google Ads session source

Last click Google Ads session keyword match type
Last click Google Ads session keyword text
Last click Google Ads session query match type
Last click session ad account name
Last click session campaign ad group ID
Last click session campaign ad group name
Last click session campaign ad network type

Last click session campaign external customer ID
Last click session campaign query word count

Last click session query match type

Last engaged Google Ads session query match type
Last engaged session ad group ID
Last engaged session ad group name

Last engaged session campaign query word count
Last engaged session campaign source / medium
Last engaged session keyword match type
Last engaged session query match type
Session campaign ID
lines.desc: The ID of the campaign that was associated with the start of a session.

lines.name: Session campaign
lines.desc: The campaign that was associated with the start of a session.

lines.name: Session default channel grouping
lines.desc: The default channel grouping that was associated with the start of a session.

lines.name: Session Google Ads account name
lines.desc: The name of the Google Ads account name that referred the user's session.

lines.name: Session Google Ads ad group ID
lines.desc: The Google Ads ad group ID that referred the user's session.

lines.name: Session Google Ads ad group name
lines.desc: The name of the Google Ads ad group to which the user's session is attributed.

lines.name: Session Google Ads ad network type
lines.desc: The ad network that referred the user's session.

lines.name: Session Google Ads campaign ID
lines.desc: The Campaign ID for the Google Ads Campaign that led to this session.

lines.name: Session Google Ads campaign
lines.desc: The Campaign name for the Google Ads Campaign that led to this session.

lines.name: Session Google Ads campaign type
lines.desc:
The campaign type for the Google Ads campaign that led to this session. 
Campaign types determine where customers see your ads and the settings and 
options available to you in Google Ads. Campaign type is an enumeration 
that includes: Search, Display, Shopping, Video, Discovery, App, Smart, 
Hotel, Local, and Performance Max. To learn more, see 
https://support.google.com/google-ads/answer/2567043.

lines.name: Session Google Ads creative ID
lines.desc:
The ID of the Google Ads creative that lead to a session on your website or 
app. Creative IDs identify individual ads.

lines.name: Session Google Ads customer ID
lines.desc: The Google Ads customer ID that referred the user's session.

lines.name: Session Google Ads default channel grouping
Session Google Ads keyword text
lines.desc: The Google Ads keyword that referred the user's session

lines.name: Session Google Ads query
lines.desc: The Google Ads query that referred the user's session

lines.name: Session manual ad content
lines.desc: The ad content that was associated with the start of a session.

lines.name: Session manual term
lines.desc: The term that was associated with the start of a session.

lines.name: Session medium
lines.desc: The medium that was associated with the start of a session.

lines.name: Session SA360 ad group name
lines.desc: The name of the ad group in Search Ads 360 that referred the user's session.

lines.name: Session SA360 campaign ID
lines.desc: The Campaign ID from Search Ads 360 that led to this session.

lines.name: Session SA360 campaign
lines.desc: The name of the campaign in Search Ads 360 that referred the user's session.

lines.name: Session SA360 creative format
lines.desc: The type of creative in Search Ads 360 that referred the user's session (for example, 'Responsive search ad', 'Expanded text ad').

lines.name: Session SA360 default channel grouping
lines.desc: The default channel grouping that referred the user's session (for example, 'paid search', 'paid social').

lines.name: Session SA360 engine account ID
lines.desc: The ID of the engine account in Search Ads 360 that referred the user's session.

lines.name: Session SA360 engine account name
lines.desc: The name of the engine account in Search Ads 360 that referred the user's session.

lines.name: Session SA360 engine account type
lines.desc: The type of the engine account in Search Ads 360 that referred the user's session (for example, 'google ads', 'bing', 'baidu').

lines.name: Session SA360 keyword text
lines.desc: The search engine keyword by which you acquired traffic. Learn more

lines.name: Session SA360 medium
lines.desc: A representation of the billable outcome for a given Search Ads 360 campaign (e.g. 'CPC').

lines.name: Session SA360 query
lines.desc: The search term by which you acquired traffic.

lines.name: Session SA360 source
lines.desc: The origin of traffic that referred the user's session (for example, 'example.com', 'google', 'spring_newsletter').

lines.name: Session source
lines.desc: The source that was associated with the start of a session.

lines.name: Session source / medium
lines.desc: The source and medium that was associated with the start of a session.

lines.name: Session source platform
lines.desc: The source platform that was associated with the start of a session.

lines.name: User acquired Google Ads account name
User acquired Google Ads ad group ID
lines.desc: The ad group ID by which the user was first acquired, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired Google Ads ad group name
lines.desc: The ad group ID by which the user was first acquired, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired Google Ads ad network type
lines.desc: The ad network by which the user was first acquired, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired Google Ads campaign ID
User acquired Google Ads campaign channel
User acquired Google Ads creative ID
lines.desc: The creative ID for the campaign by which the user was first acquired, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired Google Ads campaign external customer ID
User acquired Google Ads medium
lines.desc: The medium by which the user was first acquired, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired Google Ads campaign
lines.desc: The campaign by which the user was first acquired, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired Google Ads campaign query
User acquired Google Ads campaign query word count
User acquired Google Ads source
lines.desc: The source by which the user was first acquired, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired Google Ads source / medium
lines.desc: The source and medium by which the user was first acquired, based on the Google Ads preferred last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired Google Ads source platform
User acquired Google Ads keyword match type
User acquired Google Ads keyword text
User acquired Google Ads query match type
User acquired ad group ID
lines.desc: The ad group ID by which the user was first acquired, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired ad group name
lines.desc: The ad group ID by which the user was first acquired, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired ad network type
lines.desc: The ad network by which the user was first acquired, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired creative ID
lines.desc: The Ads creative ID by which the user was first acquired, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired campaign external customer ID
User acquired campaign medium
lines.desc: The medium by which the user was first acquired, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired campaign
lines.desc: The campaign by which the user was first acquired, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired campaign query word count
User acquired campaign source
lines.desc: The source by which the user was first acquired, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired campaign source / medium
lines.desc: The source and medium by which the user was first acquired, based on the Cross-channel last click attribution model.

lines.name: User acquired engaged Google Ads account name
User acquired engaged Google Ads ad group ID
User acquired engaged Google Ads ad group name
User acquired engaged Google Ads ad network type
User acquired engaged Google Ads campaign ID
User acquired engaged Google Ads campaign channel
User acquired engaged Google Ads campaign external customer ID
User acquired engaged Google Ads medium
User acquired engaged Google Ads campaign
User acquired engaged Google Ads campaign query
User acquired engaged Google Ads campaign query word count
User acquired engaged Google Ads source
User acquired engaged Google Ads source / medium
User acquired engaged Google Ads source platform
User acquired engaged Google Ads campaign type
User acquired engaged Google Ads keyword match type
User acquired engaged Google Ads keyword text
User acquired engaged Google Ads query match type
User acquired engaged ad group ID
User acquired engaged ad group name
User acquired engaged ad network type
User acquired engaged campaign external customer ID
User acquired engaged campaign query word count
User acquired engaged keyword match type
User acquired engaged query match type
Churn probability
lines.desc: The probability that a user who was active on your app or site in the last 7 days will not be active in the next 7 days.

lines.name: Purchase probability
lines.desc: The probability that a user who was active in the last 28 days will make a purchase in the next 7 days.

lines.name: In-app purchase probability
lines.desc: The probability that a user who was active in the last 28 days will make an in-app purchase in the next 7 days.

lines.name: Predicted revenue
lines.desc: The revenue expected from all purchase conversions within the next 28 days from a user who was active in the last 28 days.

lines.name: Video provider
lines.desc: The source of the video (e.g., 'youtube').

lines.name: Video title
lines.desc: The title of the video.

lines.name: Video URL
lines.desc: The url of the video.

lines.name: User property
lines.desc: User-scoped Custom Dimension for parameter_name.  Index values from 01 to 110

lines.name: Custom parameter dimension
lines.desc: Event-scoped Custom Dimension for parameter_name.  Index values from 01 to 135

lines.name: Custom parameter metric
lines.desc: An event scoped custom metric for your Analytics property.  Index values from 01 to 135

lines.name: Currency
lines.desc: The currency code (based on the ISO 4217 standard) of the event.

lines.name: Item affiliation
lines.desc: The name or code of the affiliate (i.e., partner or vender) associated with an item (e.g., a product you sell).

lines.name: Item brand
lines.desc: The brand of an item (e.g., a product you sell).

lines.name: Item category
lines.desc: The first hierarchical category in which you classified an item (e.g., a product you sell). For example, in Apparel/Mens/Summer/Shirts/T-shirts, Apparel is the item category.

lines.name: Item category 2
lines.desc: The second hierarchical category in which you classified an item (e.g., a product you sell). For example, in Apparel/Mens/Summer/Shirts/T-shirts, Mens is the item category 2.

lines.name: Item category 3
lines.desc: The third hierarchical category in which you classified an item (e.g., a product you sell). For example, in Apparel/Mens/Summer/Shirts/T-shirts, Summer is the item category 3.

lines.name: Item category 4
lines.desc: The fourth hierarchical category in which you classified an item (e.g., a product you sell). For example, in Apparel/Mens/Summer/Shirts/T-shirts, Shirts is the item category 4.

lines.name: Item category 5
lines.desc: The fifth hierarchical category in which you classified an item (e.g., a product you sell). For example, in Apparel/Mens/Summer/Shirts/T-shirts, T-shirts is the item category 5.

lines.name: Item coupon
lines.desc: The coupon used to purchase an item (e.g., a product you sell).

lines.name: Item ID
lines.desc: The ID that you specify for an item (e.g., a product you sell). For example, you can set an ID of 'SKU_12345'.

lines.name: Item location ID
lines.desc: The ID you specify for the location of an item or promotion.

lines.name: Item name
lines.desc: The name of an item (e.g., a product you sell).

lines.name: Item variant
lines.desc: The item variant or unique code or description (e.g., XS, S, M, L for size; Red, Blue, Green, Black for color) for additional item details or options.

lines.name: Item list ID
lines.desc: An ID that you specify for a list of items (e.g., products you sell). For example, you can set an ID of 'related_products' for an item list in a related-products section.

lines.name: Item list name
lines.desc: A name that you specify for a list of items (e.g., products you sell). A name for a list of products. For example, you can set a name of 'Related Products' for an item list in a related-products section.

lines.name: Item list position
lines.desc: The position of an item (e.g., a product you sell) in a list.

lines.name: Item promotion creative name
lines.desc: The name you specify for the creative associated with a promotion.

lines.name: Item promotion creative slot
lines.desc: The name you specify for the slot where you show the creative associated with a promotion.

lines.name: Item promotion ID
lines.desc: The ID you specify for a promotion.

lines.name: Item promotion name
lines.desc: The name you specify for a promotion.

lines.name: Local item price
lines.desc: The price of the item, localized by its currency code.

lines.name: Order coupon
lines.desc: The coupon name or code that you specify for discounted items.

lines.name: Product ID
lines.desc: The product codes of items sold.

lines.name: Shipping tier
lines.desc: The shipping tier (e.g. Ground, Air, Next-day) selected for delivery of the purchase.

lines.name: Transaction ID
lines.desc: An identifier you create for an ecommerce transaction. Learn more

lines.name: Add-to-carts
lines.desc: The number of times users added items to their shopping carts.

lines.name: Checkouts
lines.desc: The number of times users started the checkout process.

lines.name: Ecommerce revenue
lines.desc: Total revenue from purchase events, including tax and shipping.

lines.name: Ecommerce purchases
lines.desc: The number of times users completed a purchase.

lines.name: Ecommerce quantity
lines.desc:
The number of items included in an ecommerce event.

          For example, someone purchases 1 quantity of the Stan and Friends Tee and 2 quantities of the Google Grey Women's Tee. When you include these in the items array, you see the following results:

          
            Ecommerce quantity is 3
            Item quantity for Stan and Friends Tee is 1
            Item quantity for Google Grey Women's Tee is 2

lines.name: Item discount amount
lines.desc: The monetary value of a discount from multiplying the discount and quantity parameters.

lines.name: Items added to cart
lines.desc: The number of items added to a shopping cart (e.g., 1, 2, 3). Learn more

lines.name: Items checked out
lines.desc: The number of items in the customer's shopping cart when the customer initiated the checkout process. Learn more

lines.name: Items clicked in list
lines.desc: The number of items that the customer clicked in a list of items. Learn more

lines.name: Items clicked in promotion
lines.desc: The number of items that the customer clicked in a promotion. Learn more

lines.name: Items viewed
lines.desc: The number of items that the customer viewed. Learn more

lines.name: Items viewed in list
lines.desc: The number of items that the customer viewed in a list of items. Learn more

lines.name: Items viewed in promotion
lines.desc: The number of items that the customer viewed in a promotion. Learn more

lines.name: Item purchase quantity
lines.desc: The number of units for a single item included in purchase events. Learn more

lines.name: Item quantity
lines.desc:
The number of units for a single item included in an ecommerce event.

          For example, someone purchases 1 quantity of the Stan and Friends Tee and 2 quantities of the Google Grey Women's Tee. When you include these in the items array, you see the following results:

          
            Ecommerce quantity is 3
            Item quantity for Stan and Friends Tee is 1
            Item quantity for Google Grey Women's Tee is 2

lines.name: Item refund
lines.desc: The number of times an item refund was initiated.

lines.name: Item revenue
lines.desc:
The total revenue from items only, excluding tax and shipping.

          Item revenue = Price x Quantity, where:

          
            Price is the price parameter for an item in the items array
            Quantity is the quantity parameter for an item in the items array

lines.name: Item list clicks
lines.desc: The number of times users clicked an item that appeared in a list.

lines.name: Item list click through rate
lines.desc: The number of users who selected a list(s) divided by the number of users who viewed the same list(s).

lines.name: Item list views
lines.desc: The number of times an item list was viewed.

lines.name: Item promotion clicks
lines.desc: The number of times an item promotion was clicked.

lines.name: Item promotion click through rate
lines.desc: The number of users who selected a promotion(s) divided by the number of users who viewed the same promotion(s).

lines.name: Item promotion views
lines.desc: The number of times an item promotion was viewed.

lines.name: Quantity
lines.desc: The number of units for an ecommerce event.

lines.name: Product revenue
lines.desc: Product Revenue includes In-App Revenue, Ecommerce Revenue, App Subscriptions, and Virtual Currency Spent.

lines.name: Item views
lines.desc: The number of times an item's details were viewed.

lines.name: Purchases
lines.desc: The total number of purchases on your website or application.

lines.name: Refunds
lines.desc: The total number of refunds on your website or application.

lines.name: Purchase revenue
lines.desc: The sum of revenue from purchases made on your website or application.

lines.name: Shipping amount
lines.desc: The shipping amount associated with a transaction.

lines.name: Tax amount
lines.desc: The tax amount associated with a transaction.

lines.name: Transactions
lines.desc: The total number of completed purchases on your site.

lines.name: Transactions per purchaser
lines.desc: The average number of purchases per buyer for the selected time frame.

lines.name: Age
lines.desc: The age of the user by bracket. Brackets include '18-24', '25-34', '35-44', '45-54', '55-64', and '65+'.

lines.name: Interests
lines.desc: The interests of the user (such as Arts & Entertainment, Games, Sports). Users can be counted in multiple interest categories. This is the same concept as affinity segments in Google Ads.

lines.name: Interest IDs
lines.desc: Interests demonstrated by users who are higher in the shopping funnel. Users can be counted in multiple interest categories.

lines.name: Gender
lines.desc: The gender of the user (i.e., 'Male' or 'Female').

lines.name: In-market interest ID
lines.desc: The name of the in-market audience (the group of people who are actively searching and comparing your product or service).

lines.name: Achievement ID
lines.desc: An ID for an achievement that a user can unlock in a game.

lines.name: Character
lines.desc: The name of a character used in a game.

lines.name: Level
lines.desc: The level number in a game.

lines.name: Virtual currency name
lines.desc: The name of a virtual currency in a game.

lines.name: City
lines.desc: The city from which user activity originates. For example, if someone visits your website from New York City, the text 'New York' populates the dimension.

lines.name: City ID
lines.desc: An ID associated with the city from which user activity originated. For example, if activity originates from Seattle, the value '1027744' populates the dimension.

lines.name: Continent ID
lines.desc: The UN M49 ID associated with the continent from which user activity originated. For example, if someone visits your website from the United States, the value '019' populates the dimension.

lines.name: Continent
lines.desc: The continent from which user activity originated. For example, if someone visits your websites from the United States, the text 'Americas' populates the dimension.

lines.name: Country
lines.desc: The country from which user activity originated. For example, if someone visits your website from the United States, the text 'United States' populates the dimension.

lines.name: Country ID
lines.desc: The ISO 3166 ID associated with the country from which user activity originated. For example, if activity originates from the United States, the value 'US' populates the dimension.

lines.name: Region
lines.desc: The geographic region from which user activity originated. For example, if someone visits your website from New York City, the text 'New York' populates the dimension. If someone visits your website from England, the text 'England' populates the dimension.

lines.name: Region ID
lines.desc: An ID for the geographic region from which user activity originates. For example, if someone visits your website from New York City, the text 'US-NY' populates the dimension. If someone visits your website from England, the text 'GB-ENG' populates the dimension.

lines.name: Subcontinent
lines.desc: The subcontinent from which user activity originated. For example, if someone visits your website from the United States, the text 'Northern America' populates the dimension.

lines.name: Subcontinent ID
lines.desc: The UN M49 ID associated with the subcontinent from which user activity originates. For example, if someone visits your website from the United States, the value '021' populates the dimension.

lines.name: App store
lines.desc: The store from which your mobile app was downloaded and installed.

lines.name: App version
lines.desc: The mobile app's versionName (Android) or short bundle version (iOS).

lines.name: Browser
lines.desc: The browser from which user activity originated. Typical browsers include 'Chrome', 'Edge', 'Firefox', 'Internet Explorer', 'Opera', and 'Safari'.

lines.name: Browser version
lines.desc: The version of the browser from which user activity originated. For example, the browser version might be '96.0.4664.110'.

lines.name: Device category
lines.desc: The type of device from which user activity originated. Device categories include 'desktop', 'mobile', and 'tablet'.

lines.name: Device model
lines.desc: The device model name (e.g., iPhone 5s or SM-J500M).

lines.name: Language
lines.desc: The name of the language of a user's browser or device (e.g., 'French', 'English').

lines.name: Device brand
lines.desc: The brand name of the mobile device (e.g., Motorola, LG, or Samsung).

lines.name: Device
lines.desc: The mobile device from which user activity originated.

lines.name: Mobile model
lines.desc: The mobile device model name (e.g., 'iPhone X').

lines.name: Operating system
lines.desc: The operating system used by visitors on your website or application. Typical operating systems include 'Android', 'Chrome OS', 'Macintosh', and 'Windows'.

lines.name: Operating system with version
lines.desc: The operating system and version used by visitors on your website or application.

lines.name: Platform
lines.desc: The method by which users accessed your website or application. Platforms include 'Android', 'iOS', and 'Web'.

lines.name: Platform / device category
lines.desc: The platform and device on which your app or website ran; for example, web / desktop, android / mobile, or ios / tablet.

lines.name: OS version
lines.desc: The operating system version used by visitors on your website or application. (e.g., '9.3.2' or '5.1.1').

lines.name: Screen resolution
lines.desc: The width and height (in pixels) of the screen from which user activity originates. Examples include '1920x1080', '1440x900', and '1366x768'.

lines.name: Stream ID
lines.desc: The ID of the stream from which users activity originated. You can find your stream IDs by going to Admin > Data Streams.

lines.name: Stream name
lines.desc: The name of the stream from which users activity originated. You can find your stream names by going to Admin > Data Streams.

lines.name: Language code
lines.desc: The language setting of a user’s browser or device, displayed as the ISO 639 language code (e.g., ‘en-us', 'es', 'zh-cn').

lines.name: ARPU
lines.desc: Average revenue per active user (ARPU) is the total revenue generated on average from each active user, whether they made a purchase or not.

lines.name: Average daily revenue
lines.desc: The average total revenue for a day over the selected time frame.

lines.name: ARPPU
lines.desc: Average revenue per paying user (ARPPU) is the total purchase revenue per active user who made a purchase.

lines.name: Average purchase revenue per user
lines.desc: The sum of the purchase revenue per user.

lines.name: Average purchase revenue
lines.desc: The average purchase revenue over the selected time frame.

lines.name: Total revenue
lines.desc: The total revenue from purchases, in-app purchases, subscriptions, and advertising revenue.

lines.name: Max daily revenue
lines.desc: The maximum total revenue for a day over the selected time frame.

lines.name: Min daily revenue
lines.desc: The minimum total revenue for a day over the selected time frame.

lines.name: Date
lines.desc: The date when an event was collected, formatted as YYYYMMDD.

lines.name: Date + hour (YYYYMMDDHH)
lines.desc: The date and hour when a user activity occurred.

lines.name: Date hour and minute
lines.desc: The combined values of date, hour, and minute formatted as YYYYMMDDHHMM.

lines.name: Day
lines.desc: The day of the month when an event was collected, formatted as a two-digit number from 01 to 31.

lines.name: Day of week
lines.desc:
The day of the week. It returns values in the range [0,6] with Sunday as 
the first day of the week.

lines.name: Hour
lines.desc: The hour when an event was collected, formatted as a two-digit number from 0 to 23.

lines.name: Minute
lines.desc:
The two-digit minute of the hour that the event was logged. This dimension 
ranges from 0-59 and is reported in your property's timezone.

lines.name: Month
lines.desc: The month when an event was collected, formatted as a two-digit number from 01 to 12.

lines.name: Nth day
lines.desc: The number of days since the start of the specified date range.

lines.name: Nth hour
lines.desc: The number of hours since the start of the specified date range.

lines.name: Nth minute
lines.desc:
The number of minutes since the start of the date range. The starting 
minute is 0000.

lines.name: Nth month
lines.desc: The number of months since the start of the specified date range.

lines.name: Nth week
lines.desc: The number of weeks since the start of the specified date range.

lines.name: Nth year
lines.desc: The number of years since the start of the specified date range.

lines.name: Realtime minutes ago
lines.desc:
The number of minutes ago that an event was collected. 00 is the current 
minute, and 01 means the previous minute.

lines.name: Week
lines.desc: The week when an event was collected, formatted as a two-digit number from 01 to 53.

lines.name: Year
lines.desc: The year when an event was collected, formatted as a four-digit number (e.g., '2020').

lines.name: First open date
lines.desc: The UTC date and time when a user first opened an app.

lines.name: First purchase date
lines.desc: The date of the user's first purchase.

lines.name: First session date
lines.desc: The date, in the format YYYYMMDD, when a user was first acquired. First session date includes data about users who open a progressive web application (PWA) or instant app without installing the app.

lines.name: First visit date
lines.desc: The date, in the format YYYYMMDD, when a user was first acquired.

lines.name: Last audience name
lines.desc: The name of an audience that users currently belong to.

lines.name: Last active date
lines.desc: The date of the user's most recent engagement.

lines.name: Last platform
lines.desc: The method by which a user most recently accessed your website or application. Platforms include 'Android', 'iOS', and 'Web'.

lines.name: Last purchase date
lines.desc: The date of the user's most recent purchase.

lines.name: Lifetime ad revenue
lines.desc: The ad revenue you generate from someone since their first visit to your website or app.

lines.name: Lifetime engaged sessions
lines.desc: The number of engaged sessions a user had since they first visited your website or application.

lines.name: Lifetime engagement duration
lines.desc: The length of time since a user's first visit that the user was active on your website or application while it was in the foreground.

lines.name: LTV
lines.desc: Lifetime value (LTV) shows the total revenue from purchases on your website or application. You can use the data to determine how valuable users are based on additional revenue you generate.

lines.name: Lifetime session duration
lines.desc: The total duration of user sessions, from their first session until the current session expires, including time when your website or application is in the background.

lines.name: Lifetime sessions
lines.desc: The total number of sessions that a user had since their first visit to your website or application.

lines.name: Lifetime transactions
lines.desc: The total number of completed purchases by a user since their first visit to your website or application.

lines.name: Ads cost per click
lines.desc: The average cost you paid for each click on your AdMob ads.

lines.name: Ads clicks
lines.desc:
Total number of times users have clicked on an ad to reach the property. 
Includes clicks from linked integrations like linked Search Ads 360 
advertisers. Also includes uploaded clicks from data import.

lines.name: Ads cost
lines.desc: The total amount you paid for your ads.

lines.name: Ads impressions
lines.desc:
The total number of impressions. Includes impressions from linked 
integrations like linked Display & Video 360 advertisers. Also includes 
uploaded impressions from data import.

lines.name: Google Ads clicks
lines.desc: The number of times users clicked on your AdMob ads (event triggered: ad_click). Note that Clicks and Sessions (event triggered: session_start), often differ. Learn more.

lines.name: Google Ads cost
lines.desc: The total amount you paid for your TrueView ads.

lines.name: Google Ads cost per click
lines.desc: The average cost you paid for each click on your AdMob ads.

lines.name: Non-Google clicks
lines.desc: The total number of times users clicked on your ad.

lines.name: Non-Google cost
lines.desc: The total cost of your advertising campaign.

lines.name: Non-Google cost per click
lines.desc: The average amount you paid per click for your advertising campaign.

lines.name: Non-Google cost per conversion
lines.desc: The average cost you paid per conversion for your advertising campaign.

lines.name: Non-Google impressions
lines.desc: The total number of times your advertising campaign was shown to users.

lines.name: Return on non-Google ad spend
lines.desc: The total amount of revenue earned for every dollar spent on advertising.

lines.name: Link classes
lines.desc: The HTML class attribute for an outbound link or file download. For example, if a user clicks a link '<a class='center' href='www.youtube.com'>', this dimension returns 'center'.

lines.name: Link domain
lines.desc: The destination domain of an outbound link or file download. For example, if a user clicks a link '<a href='www.youtube.com'>', this dimension returns 'youtube.com'.

lines.name: Link ID
lines.desc: The HTML id attribute for an outbound link or file download. For example, if a user clicks a link '<a id='socialLinks' href='www.youtube.com'>', this dimension returns 'socialLinks'.

lines.name: Link text
lines.desc: The link text of a file download.

lines.name: Link URL
lines.desc: The full URL for an outbound link or file download. For example, if a user clicks a link '<a href='https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=analytics'>', this dimension returns 'https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=analytics'.

lines.name: Outbound
lines.desc: The text 'true' when a link leads to a website that's not a part of the property’s domain.

lines.name: Has Google Ads conversion type configuration difference
App-instance ID
lines.desc:
Analytics automatically generates and assigns an app-instance ID to each instance of your app. The ID is used to compute user metrics throughout Analytics.



  Learn more about accessing and resetting the ID

lines.name: Funnel next action
lines.desc:
The next action is the next dimension value attained by the user after 
completing the current step & inclusive of completing the next step. For 
example if the requested next action dimension is 'eventName', then this 
dimension returns the name of the next event after attaining the i'th step; 
this next action is exclusive of the event that attained the i'th step and 
inclusive of the event that attained the i+1'th step.

lines.name: Step
lines.desc:
The descriptive name assigned to the funnel step. For example, specifying 
'name = Purchase' in the third funnel step in the request will produce '3. 
Purchase' for this 'funnelStepName' dimension in the funnel report response.

lines.name: New vs continuing
lines.desc:
A user is continuing in funnel steps if they were present in the prior 
funnel step. Otherwise, that user is new. This dimension is only meaningful 
for open funnels and returns two values: 'new' and 'continuing'.

lines.name: Message time
lines.desc: The time the Firebase Cloud Messaging campaign was started.

lines.name: Segment
lines.desc:
A segment is a subset of your Analytics data. For example, of your entire 
set of users, one segment might be users from a particular country or city. 
To learn more, see Segment builder. The segment dimension returns the name 
assigned to the segment in the request with a 1-based prefix (i.e. if the 
first segment is named 'Paid Traffic' in the request, then this segment 
will be '1. Paid Traffic' in the response). If segments names are not 
specified in the request, segments are named by 1-based names (i.e. '1. 
Segment', '2. Segment', etc.).

lines.name: User ID
lines.desc: A unique ID that lets you associate a single user with engagement via multiple devices. Learn more about User-ID.

lines.name: A/B testing exact count total users
30-day active users
lines.desc: The number of unique users on your site or app within a 30 day period. The 30 day period includes the last day in your active date range. How Analytics calculates the number of users.

lines.name: Cost per conversion
lines.desc: The cost per conversion, calculated as the total cost divided by the number of selected conversion(s)

lines.name: Ads preferred last click attributed conversions
lines.desc: For the selected conversion events, the number of attributed conversions using this attribution model

lines.name: Ads preferred last click attributed revenue
lines.desc: For the selected conversion events, the amount of attributed conversions using this attribution model

lines.name: Ads preferred last click path attributed conversions
Touchpoints to conversion
lines.desc: The number of ad interactions it takes for users to convert

lines.name: Average custom parameter metric
lines.desc: The average value of an Event-scoped Custom Metric for parameter_name

lines.name: Average days to conversion
lines.desc: The number of days from when the ad interaction happened until the conversion

lines.name: Purchaser conversion
lines.desc:
The percentage of active users who made 1 or more purchase transactions. 
This metric is returned as a fraction; for example, 0.412 means 41.2% of 
users were purchasers.

lines.name: Combined revenue per cohort total first opens
lines.desc: For each user, Google Analytics calculates the sum of purchase, subscription, and ads revenue for the first 120 days. Lifetime Value is the average of this value for all users.

lines.name: Combined revenue per cohort total first visits and first opens
lines.desc: For each user, Google Analytics calculates the sum of purchase, subscription, and ads revenue for the first 120 days. Lifetime Value is the average of this value for all users.

lines.name: Combined revenue per cohort total first visits
lines.desc: For each user, Google Analytics calculates the sum of purchase, subscription, and ads revenue for the first 120 days. Lifetime Value is the average of this value for all users.

lines.name: Cost per conversion
lines.desc: Cost per conversion is ad cost divided by conversions.

lines.name: Count of custom parameter metric
lines.desc: The number of occurrences of an Event-scoped Custom Metric for parameter_name

lines.name: Crash-affected users
lines.desc:
The number of users that logged a crash in this row of the report. For 
example if the report is time series by date, this metrics reports total 
users with at least one crash on this date. Crashes are events with the 
name "app_exception".

lines.name: Crash-free users rate
lines.desc:
The number of users without crash events (in this row of the report) 
divided by the total number of users. This metric is returned as a 
fraction; for example, 0.9243 means 92.43% of users were crash-free.

lines.name: Data driven attributed conversions
lines.desc: For the selected conversion events, the number of attributed conversions using this attribution model

lines.name: Data driven attributed revenue
lines.desc: For the selected conversion events, the amount of attributed conversions using this attribution model

lines.name: First click attributed conversions
lines.desc: For the selected conversion events, the number of attributed conversions using this attribution model

lines.name: First click attributed revenue
lines.desc: For the selected conversion events, the amount of attributed conversions using this attribution model

lines.name: Abandonment rate
lines.desc:
The percentage of users that abandon the funnel at this step. This metric 
is returned as a fraction; for example, 0.412 means 41.2% of users 
abandoned the funnel at this step.

lines.name: Abandonments
lines.desc: The absolute number of users that abandon the funnel at this step.

lines.name: Completion rate
lines.desc:
The percentage of users that complete this step of the funnel. This metric 
is returned as a fraction; for example, 0.588 means 58.8% of users 
completed this funnel step.

lines.name: Last click attributed conversions
lines.desc: For the selected conversion events, the number of attributed conversions using this attribution model

lines.name: Last click attributed revenue
lines.desc: For the selected conversion events, the amount of attributed conversions using this attribution model

lines.name: Linear attributed conversions
lines.desc: For the selected conversion events, the number of attributed conversions using this attribution model

lines.name: Linear attributed revenue
lines.desc: For the selected conversion events, the amount of attributed conversions using this attribution model

lines.name: Organic google search average position
lines.desc:
The average ranking of your website URLs for the query reported from Search 
Console. For example, if your site's URL appears at position 3 for one 
query and position 7 for another query, the average position would be 5 
(3+7/2). This metric requires an active Search Console link.

lines.name: Organic google search clicks
lines.desc:
The number of organic Google Search clicks reported from Search Console. 
This metric requires an active Search Console link.

lines.name: Organic google search click through rate
lines.desc:
The organic Google Search click through rate reported from Search Console. 
Click through rate is clicks per impression. This metric is returned as a 
fraction; for example, 0.0588 means about 5.88% of impressions resulted in 
a click. This metric requires an active Search Console link.

lines.name: Organic google search impressions
lines.desc:
The number of organic Google Search impressions reported from Search 
Console. This metric requires an active Search Console link.

lines.name: Page views
lines.desc: The number of web pages your users saw. Repeated views of a single page are counted. (Event triggered: page_view).

lines.name: Position based attributed conversions
lines.desc: For the selected conversion events, the number of attributed conversions using this attribution model

lines.name: Position based attributed revenue
lines.desc: For the selected conversion events, the amount of attributed conversions using this attribution model

lines.name: Average product revenue
lines.desc: Average revenue for all products sold (total product revenue / number of products sold).

lines.name: Publisher ad clicks
lines.desc: The number of ad_click events.

lines.name: Publisher ad impressions
lines.desc: The number of ad_impression events.

lines.name: Return on ad spend
lines.desc: Return On Ad Spend (ROAS) is total revenue divided by advertiser ad cost.

lines.name: Return on ad spend
lines.desc: The return on ad spend, calculated as the revenue for selected conversions divided by the total cost for your ads

lines.name: Time decay attributed conversions
lines.desc: For the selected conversion events, the number of attributed conversions using this attribution model

lines.name: Time decay attributed revenue
lines.desc: For the selected conversion events, the amount of attributed conversions using this attribution model

lines.name: Total ad revenue
lines.desc: The sum of all advertising revenue.

lines.name: 1-day total users
lines.desc: The total number of unique users who have logged an event.

lines.name: 30-day total users
lines.desc: The total number of unique users who have logged an event.

lines.name: 7-day total users
lines.desc: The total number of unique users who have logged an event.

lines.name: Unique user scrolls
lines.desc: The number of unique users who scrolled down at least 90% of the page.

lines.name: Average engagement time per engaged session
Average engagement time per user
lines.desc: The average length of time that the app was in the foreground, or the web site had focus in the browser.

lines.name: Cart-to-view rate
lines.desc: The number of users who added an item (e.g., a product you sell) to their shopping cart per user who viewed the item.

lines.name: Purchase-to-view rate
lines.desc: The number of users who purchased an item (e.g., a product you sell) per user who viewed the item.
